hackathon-description-text: A hackathon planned by high school students for high school students, HackJA challenges participants to work in teams to compete in various computer science challanges. The presence of corporate mentors in this exciting environment provides students the guidance they need to perfect their projects while imagining their future in a STEM career. Web designers, software developers, and business oriented students can all team up to participate regardless of their computer science skill. Students will also attend relevant workshops and receive mentorship from corporate and college mentors. HackJA is an exciting opportunity for STEM oriented students to enter with an idea and leave with a tangible project to work with.

hackathon-judges.judge-role: President, Junior Achievement of New Jersey

hackathon-rules: Students who have registered for HackJA and checked-in to the event are eligible to participate. All participants must be high school students and have agreed to and reviewed the below codes of conduct.

hackathon-prizes.prize-title: Best IoT Hack Using a Qualcomm Device

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: Best Use of AWS Description: $250 AWS Credit (US Only)

hackathon-prizes.prize-title: Challenge Name: Best Domain Name from Domain.com Description
